mutableValueAsDefaultBehaviou?r.title: Mutable Argument Default Value Behavior
mutableValueAsDefaultBehaviou?r.description: Determines the behavior when a value that contains a mutable value (e.g. a list) is used as the default value for an argument in a function.
enumDescriptions: Copies the value and assign the copy to the argument, should it ever be undefined. This behavior is a lot more predictable, at the cost of some extra time processing the value, every call.
Assign the variable a reference to the existing value.
